description: The Miami HEAT is seeking a Marketing Partnership Strategy Manager! The Marketing Partnership Strategy Manager is key in helping position marketing as a revenue-generating department by optimizing and driving a high-level strategy for digital content, in-game/arena activations, and social responsibility initiatives; while identifying new, compelling opportunities. This position will work strategically with other departments such as Game Operations, Business Communications, Email Automation, Social/Digital Content Production, Creative, Influencer Marketing, Social Responsibility and Corporate Partnerships to increase and monitor the performance of partner campaigns across Miami HEAT properties to meet the goals of the Marketing and the Corporate Department.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: The following are examples of the various functions required. The job requirements are not limited to the items on this list.Contribute to the creation of a vision, strategy, and implementation plan for marketing innovation and partnerships, with the aim of driving revenue growth.Collaborate across departments to develop cohesive digital, social responsibility and experiential packages for corporate partners with specific targeted goals, quantifiable outcomes, and execution timelines that work in concert with the HEAT’s own marketing strategy/effortsStrategically identify new, compelling revenue/up-sell opportunities that elevate the Miami HEAT team and partner investmentsAssist the Corporate Sales and Service team to present and propose promising partnership opportunities to prospectsCoordinate the implementation of cross-department communication procedures and processesWork alongside the social/content, game operations and social responsibility teams to execute contracted deliverables for corporate partners and quantify the success and impact of the HEAT Group's propertiesPartner with the Business Intelligence and Marketing Analytics teams to analyze and define essential marketing strategies for both the Miami HEAT digital platforms and for our existing and potential partners to drive marketing and business objectivesAdvocate for marketing sponsorship – introduce new innovative ideas, tools and processes to drive revenueContinuously assess, innovate, and enhance our existing monetization framework to ensure its relevance and effectiveness in a constantly evolving marketing environmentUpdate and organize internal tracking platform (Monday.com) with relevant data such as budgets, contract deliverables, relevant dates, etc.Oversee the delivery of actionable marketing reports and insights across dimensions: channel, platform, campaign, and KPIDesired QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.Education And/or ExperienceBachelor’s degree in marketing or related field3 years of experience in Marketing and/or PartnershipsProficiency with Apple Software, Adobe Software, Microsoft Office including Word, Excel & PowerPoint. Canva & Monday proficiency preferred.In-depth knowledge of all social platforms including Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn required.Exceptional presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasivelyStrong organization, interpersonal, and collaboration skillsExperience working with high volume, detailed work processes and deadlinesAble to meet tight deadlines and adapt to a fast-paced, fluid environment while balancing multiple tasks at onceAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender/gender identity, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status entitled to protection under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws.
